data.title: National Basketball Players Association (NBPA)
data.meta_description: National Basketball Players Association (NBPA) | 52,711 followers on LinkedIn. The National Basketball Players Association (NBPA) is the union for current professional basketball players in the National Basketball Association (NBA). Established in 1954, the NBPA mission is to ensure that the rights of NBA players are protected and that every conceivable measure is taken to assist players in maximizing their opportunities and achieving their goals, both on and off the court.
data.text:
At this year's NBPA Top 50 Camp, the best players from the SIAC and The Southwestern Athletic Conference gathered in Atlanta to train and celebrate community as HBCU athletes. Since 2017, the camp has given HBCU student-athletes a unique opportunity to learn and develop their skills on and off the court.

NBPA Vice President Jaylen Brown and NBA Hall of Famer Jason Kidd have unveiled The XChange, a national initiative focused on bridging the racial wealth gap by generating $5 billion in net wealth for historically marginalized communities. The new nonprofit, based in Boston and Oakland, seeks to build generational wealth and promote cultural innovation within underserved and underrepresented communities. Learn more: https://prn.to/4fCVy5n

Measuring personal health data may not be new, but until now, the technology has been reserved for select groups. At the National Basketball Players Association (NBPA) Performance Summit, CLF's Deborah Embaie, MPA led a conversation with Jonathan Swerdlin, cofounder & CEO of Function Health, and Julia Klim, VP at Equinox, about how they are making this technology more accessible for everyday athletes and how it can help improve performance and longevity. Thanks National Basketball Players Association (NBPA) and Leaders in Sport for having us participate in this important conversation about the future of health!

The challenge of managing player workload is a common issue across sport. Just a day after #FIFPRO Europe and European Leagues announced their formal complaint to the European Commission against FIFA regarding the international match calendar, panels at the NBPA Performance Summit highlighted the critical role of player unions in safeguarding athletes. #FIFPRO’s Alexander Bielefeld represented the footballers’ perspective on the panel “Workload issues across sports: What are we doing to protect players?” alongside Wajid Mir from the Professional Tennis Players Association and Bostjan Nachbar from the EuroLeague Players Association (ELPA) (basketball). Moderated by Stephania Bell from ESPN, the group explored the unique challenges of their respective sports, while also identifying common ground and shared solutions. The National Basketball Players Association (NBPA), which protects and supports the rights of the 450 best basketball players in the world, hosted the two-day event in Spain, exploring the latest developments in sports performance and technology. The event was hosted by the NBPA's Matteo Zuretti and Dan O'Brien. Learn more: https://lnkd.in/dFFY6JGz
